text: Hi <@UF88QJ5RC>. Nice to meet you :wave:. I work here at HubSpot and I can help you out with this. Lets work on managing the notification issue first. This knowledge base article will help you manage your personal notifications: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/settings/how-to-set-up-user-notifications-in-HubSpot>

From the information you have provided it will probably be the 'Assign' section that you will need to adjust. In terms of the team status. Can you you direct message me with your portal ID and the name of the team so I can investigate this further for you.

Hello,

Looking for some advice on creating a blog filter like this page here - <https://theme.govnetdev.co.uk/insights/>

First of all is it possible? Second does anyone have any advice on how I can implement it? Thank you.

Hey Scott.  I haven’t implemented something like this before, but it should be possible.

The “Topics” and “Industries” dropdowns would correspond with HubSpot blog topics.

There’s some good info here on how to go about accomplishing it:

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Multiple-filters-in-blog/td-p/198720>
Also, some good info here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Filter-blog-posts-by-two-topics/td-p/20077>
Thanks <@U54TVT3C1>
No problem.  I definitely think query strings are going to be the key here
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Filter-blog-post-by-multiples-tags/m-p/307020>
<https://www.kunkalabs.com/mixitup/>
<@UD53A9UUR> thanks! looks nice
:blush:

Is it possible to implement web push notifications on the HubSpot CMS? I wanted to use this feature to make customers aware when we have a particular isotope available and to reserve it in advance before we run out. Outside of push notifications, I am also interested in what people have used for notification bars and similar functionality that has worked well on the HubSpot CMS?

you can create push notifications using the web notifications api.. that will take some javascript programming to do, here is an example tutorial of how to do that. Setting this up in your header/footer in the module is an easy way to deliver this and still maange it with the HubSpot cms.

Alternatives to this are using a third party service where you pay a monthly fee. Personally I've had some difficulty integrating them. These would likely just be a simple embed code, and you use the third party service to help deliver that content.  There are a few services like this: <https://aimtell.com/> -- google "web push notifications" would be a way to find other alternatives.

Thank you. I know there are a ton of apps out there. I was looking for what is HubSpot-Friendly or if there was something built specifically for HubSpot. I don't like to reinvent the wheel if I don't have to.

<@U25PYL3Q8>: Do you by chance have experience with the HubSpot Popup Forms? I only need this on specific pages so it would also be a good option for visitors. I am wondering if pop-up blockers disable them from being shown?

I haven't used popup forms from HubSpot, and I'm not sure that you could use them to do what you are looking to do.  What I have done in the past is create a pop up that displays until they dismiss it. Once they dismiss it, it saves it to their `localStorage` using javascript
It functions pretty similar to how the gdpr notifications show up on site. If they visit from desktop and dismiss it, it will still show up on their mobile until they dismiss it
Hello everybody! How can I create a sandbox under my current company account to do the CMS course practical exam?
Every time I click on "create sandbox" it redirects me to company academy landing page without anything else to create :thinking_face:
Nevermind, I did it with a new account. :smile:

I got a question on the blog /all page. According to the Hubl doc, the /all page is…
> “A simple listing is a listing of all your posts. The simple listing is not affected by the post limit in Content Settings and generally just contains links to all the blog posts. ”  
But I found that for really large blogs, the /all page is limited to 1000 posts. I can’t seem to find a way to paginate (/all/page/2 doesn’t work).  Does anyone know if or how I can get to the next set of blogs in /all?

Hi all, is it possible to push more than name and email address to a Mailchimp list?

Specifically, my client wants to trigger a drip campaign when they hit a specific segment so we'd need to pass a hidden field value to Mailchimp too.

Thanks in advance!
